summary: React-based Focus & Execution Management System: a single-task focus app that shows one task at a time, supports energy-based task selection, backlog management, timer, step checklist, notes, stats, friction logging, plus a home-page brain-dump intake that can be converted into tasks; now includes AI-assisted parsing to turn freeform brain dumps into individual task items, with optional assistant-based categorization, all with persistent async storage.
architectural_notes: Persist data via async window.storage with keys: 'current-task', 'tasks-backlog', 'current-energy', 'user-stats'.
Task model includes: id, title, why, energy, steps, estimatedMinutes, completedSteps, note, lastFriction{reason,timestamp}.
Stats model includes: completed, streak, totalTime (minutes).
UI should update optimistically and save in background; all storage operations wrapped in try/catch; missing keys handled gracefully.
Build as a single React .jsx artifact using hooks (useState/useEffect) and lucide-react icons.
Brain Dump should optionally support speech-to-text input (e.g., via Web Speech API) behind a mic button, appending transcribed text into the draft brain-dump field.
Brain Dump conversion must reliably segregate a single freeform dump into multiple discrete task items (not one combined task); allow AI-assisted parsing to improve splitting accuracy.

Brain Dump extractor should better split speech-to-text/run-on paragraphs by detecting multi-task markers (e.g., and/then/also/after that, semicolons, bullets) while avoiding over-splitting short phrases.
Brain Dump deletion/clearing must not remove or affect tasks already converted/added to 'tasks-backlog'; tasks and brain-dump state are persisted and managed independently.
known_issues: Focus button does not consistently navigate back to the Home page from all views/screens.
Streak details are not reliably visible/accessible from the Home page.
Tasks created from Brain Dump are being removed/lost when the Brain Dump is deleted/cleared; converted tasks should remain in the tasks list/backlog.

existing_features.title: Implement the Focus & Execution Management System UI as a single React artifact file (one .jsx file) that contains all screens and modals described: Energy Selection, Empty State, Current Task View, Backlog View, Add Task Modal, Stats Dashboard Modal, and Friction Log Modal, with user-facing text in English.

Apply the specified warm, calming, distraction-free visual theme consistently across the app using Tailwind CSS: color palette (Terracotta #E07A5F, Warm amber #F2A65A, Soft brown #C89F7E, Muted brown #8B7E74), background gradient (#F7F3E9 via #FDF8ED to #F7F3E9), text colors (#3E3833 and #8B7355), soft warm shadows (rgba(139, 115, 85, 0.08–0.12)), and smooth animations with the provided cubic-bezier easing.

Implement the full client-side data model and persistence using the specified Task and Stats object shapes and the specified storage keys, using async storage operations wrapped in try/catch and handling missing keys gracefully (first-time use).

Implement the Energy Selection flow with four energy levels (DEEP, STEADY, LOW, NONE) using lucide-react icons and the specified colors/labels/descriptions; selecting an energy sets 'current-energy' and filters the backlog accordingly.

Implement the Empty State shown when an energy is set but there is no current task, including an 'All clear' message with a plant emoji and a 'Choose Next Task' action that opens/selects from backlog.

Implement the Current Task View (single-task focus screen) with: timer card (MM:SS + play/pause/reset), estimated time card, animated progress bar (% steps completed), 'Why this matters' card with left border accent, large centered task title, and a quick note feature that persists to the current task.

Implement the execution steps checklist for the current task: each step renders as an interactive button with checkbox animation; toggling completion updates task.completedSteps and the progress bar; completed steps show strikethrough and reduced opacity; include 'Can't do this now' (skip) and 'Complete!' actions.

Implement task completion behavior: on 'Complete!', add focused time to stats.totalTime (in minutes), increment stats.completed and stats.streak, clear 'current-task', and prompt the user to choose the next task from backlog.

Implement task skipping with friction logging: clicking 'Can't do this now' opens the Friction Log modal with the six preset reasons; selecting a reason saves task.lastFriction {reason, timestamp}, moves the task back to 'tasks-backlog', resets stats.streak to 0, clears 'current-task', and persists all updates.

Implement Backlog View with: header (title/description), 'Add Task' button, energy filter chips (All Tasks + 4 energy levels) with active highlight using energy colors, and a list of task cards showing title, why, energy badge, time estimate, step count, last friction indicator, and a chevron. Selecting a task sets it as 'current-task' and removes it from 'tasks-backlog'.

Implement the Add Task Modal form with fields and validation: required Task title, optional why, estimated time (number input default 30), energy selector (2x2 grid), dynamic steps array (add/remove), and Cancel/Add buttons. On Add, create a Task object matching the required shape (including id, completedSteps default empty, note default empty, lastFriction default unset/empty) and persist it into 'tasks-backlog'.

Implement the Stats Dashboard Modal and header elements: header includes 'Focus' title, streak badge (Award icon) when streak > 0, current energy indicator, Stats button (TrendingUp icon), and Backlog button with task count (Menu icon). Stats modal shows three stat cards (Tasks Completed with Target icon, Current Streak with Award icon, Time Focused in minutes with Clock icon) each with gradient background matching stat type.

Ensure responsive layout and interaction polish: max-width centered containers, hover states on all buttons with scale transforms (1.02–1.05), page-load slide-up animation (0.6s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1)), modal fade-in + scale-in, and staggered list-item entrance animations (index * 0.05s or 0.1s).
Add an in-app chatbot-style assistant that suggests which energy category (Deep Focus, Steady Work, Low Energy, No-Brain) a task should be placed into based on the task text the user provides.
Integrate the assistant into the existing task creation flow so the user can apply the suggested category to the task they are adding without retyping it.
Implement the categorization logic locally (without external AI/LLM calls) using transparent, deterministic heuristics that map task text to one of the four energy categories.

Add a new Brain Dump view/section accessible from the main home screen (the same top-level area as the current 'main' and 'backlog' views) that lets the user paste/type a freeform brain dump and turns it into individual brain-dump items.

Integrate the existing local energy categorization assistant/heuristics into the Brain Dump list so each brain-dump item can be categorized into one of the four existing energy categories (DEEP, STEADY, LOW, NONE) and show the suggested category per item.

Allow moving one or multiple brain-dump items into the existing tasks backlog by converting them into Task objects that match the current Task shape used in the app and persisting them into the existing 'tasks-backlog' storage key.

Persist Brain Dump draft text and/or the Brain Dump item list locally so the user does not lose their brain dump if they refresh the page, and restore it on load with graceful handling if the key is missing or corrupted.
Add a microphone button to the Brain Dump draft input section that lets the user dictate a brain dump using in-browser speech-to-text and inserts the transcript into the Brain Dump textarea.

Enhance the Brain Dump "Convert to Items" behavior so freeform brain dump text is converted into a clean list of individual task items using local, deterministic "AI-like" parsing (no external AI/LLM calls). The parser should handle common real-world input formats beyond one-item-per-line, including: bullets (•, -, *), numbered lists ("1.", "1)"), semicolon-separated phrases, and multi-task sentences (e.g., "Email Alex and schedule dentist, then pay rent") by splitting them into separate, concise items while avoiding over-splitting short phrases.

Make the "Focus" button/label act as a global "go to Home" action: from any non-home view (e.g., Backlog view, Brain Dump view) and from any open modal, pressing the Focus control must navigate the user back to the Home (main) view.
Ensure streak details are always visible on the Home (main) view header, including when the streak value is 0, using clear English text.

Strengthen the Brain Dump task extraction so freeform brain dump text is reliably segregated into multiple individual task items (instead of being treated as one single task) when the input contains common multi-task patterns (e.g., bullets, numbered lists, semicolons, and multi-clause sentences like "Email Alex and schedule dentist, then pay rent"). This must remain local, deterministic, and must not use external AI/LLM calls.

Remove the UI element that displays the currently selected task type/energy as a fixed chip in the top header (e.g., the “Deep Focus” pill shown next to the streak) so that after the user selects one of the four energy types, that energy type is not shown anywhere as a pinned header element.

Enhance the Brain Dump view so the Energy Assistant can take a full brain dump and produce (1) a list of individual task items and (2) an automatic categorization for each item into the four existing energy types (DEEP, STEADY, LOW, NONE) in one user action, while keeping the existing ability to manually edit an item’s text and override its category.

Remove the Energy Assistant action/button from the Brain Dump view UI and replace it with a simple conversion action that only converts the Brain Dump draft text into multiple distinct task items (using the existing local deterministic extraction logic).
Update Brain Dump view helper copy to remove references to an “Energy Assistant” and describe the conversion behavior as splitting the brain dump into individual tasks (English user-facing text).

Ensure the “Add Task” button flow allows users to manually create a task and explicitly choose its category (energy type) from the four existing categories (DEEP, STEADY, LOW, NONE), and that the selected category is saved on the task and reflected in backlog filtering.

Upgrade the Brain Dump “Convert to Tasks” behavior to more reliably convert an entire freeform brain dump into multiple distinct task items using local, deterministic AI-like parsing (no external AI/LLM calls), ensuring the extractor identifies distinct possible tasks across the whole dump instead of returning a single combined task when common multi-task patterns are present.

Improve the Brain Dump conversion so that clicking “Convert to Tasks” reliably extracts multiple distinct task items from a single spoken/freeform brain dump (often transcribed as one long paragraph) instead of returning one combined task.

Upgrade the local deterministic extractor (frontend/src/lib/brainDumpTaskExtractor.ts) to better handle speech-to-text patterns and “abstract thoughts” phrasing by adding robust splitting/normalization rules that work for long run-on sentences (e.g., “I need to… also… and… then…”) while still avoiding over-splitting short phrases.

Update Brain Dump helper copy in the Brain Dump view to accurately describe the behavior as local “smart parsing” (AI-like) that runs in the app, without implying any external AI service; keep all user-facing text in English.

Fix the local Brain Dump task extractor so that “Convert to Tasks” reliably returns multiple distinct tasks for common multi-task inputs (especially speech-to-text paragraphs), instead of collapsing the entire dump into one combined task.

Ensure the Brain Dump UI’s “Convert to Tasks” action uses the updated extractor output end-to-end, so that the Extracted Tasks list renders one UI item per extracted task (instead of a single item containing the entire dump).

Ensure that clearing/deleting the Brain Dump (clearing the Brain Dump draft text and/or extracted Brain Dump items) never removes or alters tasks that have already been added to the main tasks backlog (stored under the existing 'tasks-backlog' key).
Add/adjust Brain Dump view helper text to clearly state that clearing the Brain Dump only clears the Brain Dump draft/items and that tasks already added to the backlog will remain.

new_feature_requests.summary: Single-task focus UI with current task view (title, why, steps checklist, notes, progress, complete/skip actions)
Energy selection flow (4 energy levels with icons/colors) that filters tasks and persists current energy
Backlog view with energy filters, task cards, and ability to select a task as current (removing from backlog)
Timer component (play/pause/reset, MM:SS) and add focused time to stats upon completion
Add Task modal with form fields (title, why, estimated time, energy, dynamic steps)
Stats dashboard modal (completed tasks, streak, total time)
Friction log modal on skip with preset reasons; logs friction and resets streak; returns task to backlog
Persistent storage layer using async window.storage API with graceful missing-key handling and try/catch
Warm, calming visual design system (colors, fonts, shadows) with smooth animations and responsive layout
AI chatbot/assistant that classifies a task into an energy category (Deep Focus, Steady Work, Low Energy, No Brain)

Home-page Brain Dump page/section: capture freeform brain dump items, convert them into tasks list/backlog entries, and use the in-app assistant to help categorize items into energy categories before adding
Add a microphone button in the Brain Dump view to capture spoken input and transcribe it into the brain dump text (speech-to-text)
Brain Dump: use AI to parse freeform brain dump text into a list of individual task items (auto-splitting/extraction)
Make the Focus button act as a global 'go to Home' action from any view/screen
Ensure streak details are visible on the Home page (streak badge/value accessible from main view)
Use AI-assisted parsing to split Brain Dump input into multiple individual task items (avoid treating the whole dump as a single task)
Remove the task type/energy type selection and the fixed task type indicator from the page (do not show task type pinned at the top after initial selection)
Brain Dump UI: remove/hide the Energy Assistant button; keep Brain Dump focused on converting brain-dump points into multiple distinct task items
Ensure tasks created/added from Brain Dump persist in the main tasks list/backlog even after the Brain Dump draft/items are deleted/cleared

projectName: Single-task Focus & Execution app with energy-based backlog, timer, stats, and friction logging (persistent async storage)
